wizsdk package¶

Submodules¶

wizsdk.battle module¶

class wizsdk.battle.Battle(client, name=None)¶

Bases: wizsdk.pixels.DeviceContext

find_ally(ally_image)¶

Attemps to find the position of an ally the matches the image provided returns 4, 5, 6, 7 if found otherwise returns False

find_enemy(enemy_image)¶

Attemps to find the position of an enemy that matches the image provided returns 0, 1, 2, 3 if found otherwise returns False

get_enemy_count()¶

Returns the number enemies in the fight

get_enemy_positions()¶

Returns a list of length 4 with 0, if no enemy is present at the location, or 1 if an enemy is present

is_enemy_first()¶
is_turn() → bool¶

Returns if it’s our turn to play by matching pixels in the flee button

log(message)¶
async loop()¶

Takes care of the looping logic for a battle

async next_turn() → None¶

Sleeps until next round or fight has ended Sets is_over to True if the fight has ended Increase the round_count otherwise Used in the loop() method

print_round()¶
async start() → None¶

Waits for the first round then signals to the class that the battle has started. used in the loop() method

wizsdk.card module¶

class wizsdk.card.Card(client, name, spell_x)¶

Bases: object

async cast(target=None)¶

Selects spell if target is specified, select target (0-3 for enemies, 4-7 for allies)

0 1 2 3

7 6 5 4

async enchant(spell)¶

Enchants spell with self Returns enchanted spell

wizsdk.client module¶

class wizsdk.client.Client(handle=None)¶

Bases: wizsdk.pixels.DeviceContext, wizsdk.keyboard.Keyboard, wizsdk.window.Window

async activate_hooks(*hook_names)¶

Activate a number of hooks or pass None/no args to activate all :param hook_names: The hooks to activate

Examples

async click_confirm()¶

Waits for the “confirm” prompt, and clicks “confirm”

async face_quest_destination()¶

Changes the player’s yaw to be facing the quest destination. Note: depending on your location, this may differ from where your quest arrow is pointing to

async find_spell(spell_name, threshold=0.1) → wizsdk.card.Card¶

Searches spell area for an image matching spell_name Returns x positions of spell if found returns None if not found

async finish_loading()¶

Waits for player to have gone through the loading screen. It first waits until it detects the loading screen, then waits until the loading screen is gone. If this function is called too late and the player is already out of the loading screen, it will wait indefinitely.

get_battle(name=None) → wizsdk.battle.Battle¶

Returns a Battle object linked to this client

get_confirm()¶

Detects if a “confirm” prompt is open (either from teleporting a friend or exiting an unfinished dungeon). It does this by matching a “confirm” image. :returns: (x, y) where the confirm button has been found :rtype: tuple

async get_health() → int¶

Get’s health value from memory. Triggers the player_stat_hook if needed. :returns: The health value of the player as an int

async get_mana() → int¶

Get’s mana value from memory. Triggers the player_stat_hook if needed. :returns: The mana value of the player as an int

async get_player_location()¶

Fetches the player’s XYZYaw location Requires the player_struct hook to be activated :returns: (X, Y, Z, Yaw) values of the player’s position and direction. :rtype: XYZYaw

async get_quest_xyz()¶

Gets the X, Y, Z coordinates to the quest destination Requires the quest_struct hook to be activated :returns: (X, Y, Z) value of the quest goal location. :rtype: tuple

async go_through_dialog(times=1)¶

Goes through the prompts of the dialog (“press x” or “more”/”continue”). Waits for “press x” or the dialog box before starting. :param times: Defaults to 1

The number of times to go through. (When going through quests, you might need to set this to 2. There’s one to hand in the quest, the second to get the next quest)

is_crown_shop() → bool¶

Detects if the crown shop is open by matching a red pixel in the “close” icon. :returns: True if the menu is open / False otherwise :rtype: bool

is_dialog_more()¶

Detects if the dialog (from NPCs etc.) is open by matching pixels in the “more” or “done” button. :returns: True if the dialog menu is open / False otherwise :rtype: bool

is_health_low()¶

DEPRECATED: Detects if the player’s health is low by matching a red pixel in the lower third of the globe. :returns: is the health low :rtype: bool

is_idle()¶

Detects if the player is idle (out of loading and not in battle) by matching pixels in the spellbook. :returns: True if the player is idle / False otherwise :rtype: bool

is_mana_low()¶

DEPRECATED: Detects if the player’s mana is low by matching a blue pixel in the lower third of the globe. :returns: is the mana low :rtype: bool

is_press_x()¶

Detects if the “press x” prompt is present by matching the “x” image. :returns: “press X” has been found :rtype: bool

log(message)¶

Debug log function. Useful to identify which client the log is coming from. :param message: The message to log. [client-name]: message

async logout_and_in(confirm=False)¶

Logs the user out and then logs it in again. :param confirm: Should the bot wait for a “confirm” prompt before continuing. Defaults to False

Set to True if logging out durring a battle or to exit an unfinished dungeon.

async pass_turn() → None¶

Clicks pass while in a battle

async press_x()¶

Waits for the “press x” prompt and sends the “X” key.

classmethod register(nth=0, name=None, handle=None, hooks=[])¶

Assigns the instance to a wizard101 window (Required before using any other API functions)

set_name(name)¶

Sets the window title. Useful to identify which window the bot is running on :param name: The text to prepend to the window title

async teleport_to(location: wizsdk.utils.XYZYaw)¶

Teleports to XYZYaw location Will return immediately if player movement is locked Requires the player_struct hook to be activated

Parameters

location (XYZYaw) – location to move to

async teleport_to_friend(match_img)¶

Completes a set of actions to teleport to a friend. The friend must have the proper symbol next to it. The symbol must match the image passed as ‘match_img’.

Parameters

match_img (str) – the friend icon to find to select which friend to teleport to.

async unregister()¶

Properly unregister hooks and clean up possible ongoing asyncio tasks

async use_potion_if_needed(health=1000, mana=20)¶

Clicks on a potion if health or mana values drop below the settings :param health: Health value threshold. Potion will be used if health value drops below :param mana: Mana value threshold. Potion will be used if mana value drops below

Returns

None

async wait(seconds)¶

Alias for asyncio.sleep() :param seconds: number of seconds to “sleep”

async walk_to(location: wizsdk.utils.XYZYaw)¶

Walks to XYZYaw location in a straight line only. Will _not_ work if there are obstacles in the way. Ideal for short distances Will return immediately if player movement is locked Requires the player_struct hook to be activated. NOTE: The distance will not be accurate if the player has a mount equipped. :param location: The location to walk to. (Only the x and y value will actually be used) :type location: XYZYaw

wizsdk.client.register_clients(n_handles_expected: int, names: list = [], confirm_position: bool = False)¶

n_handles_expected: the expected # of wiz windows opened. Use -1 for undetermined names: A list of strings that will serve as the names of the windows

async wizsdk.client.unregister_all()¶

wizsdk.mouse module¶

exception wizsdk.mouse.FailSafeException(message='Mouse fail-safe triggered from mouse moving to a corner of the screen.')¶

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when the mouse is over (0, 0). Protactive measure to regain control of your mouse.

class wizsdk.mouse.Mouse(window_handle=None)¶

Bases: wizsdk.window.Window

It simulates the mouse Due to there being only 1 mouse, all methods are syncronous

async click(x=- 1, y=- 1, button='left', duration=None, delay=0.1)¶

get_rel_position()¶

get mouse position relative to window

in_rect(rect_area)¶

Returns true if the mouse is in the given region

async move_out(rect_area)¶

Move the mouse outside of the given rect If the mouse is already outside, return

async move_to(x, y, duration=0.5)¶

press_button(x=- 1, y=- 1, button='left', button_up=False)¶

push a button of the mouse

wizsdk.mouse.getPointOnLine(x1, y1, x2, y2, n)¶

Returns an (x, y) tuple of the point that has progressed a proportion n along the line defined by the two x1, y1 and x2, y2 coordinates. This function was copied from pytweening module, so that it can be called even if PyTweening is not installed.

wizsdk.pixels module¶

class wizsdk.pixels.DeviceContext(handle)¶

Bases: wizsdk.window.Window

get_image(region=None)¶
get_pixel(x, y)¶
locate_on_screen(match_img, region=None, threshold=0.1, debug=False)¶

Attempts to locate match_img in the Wizard101 window. Returns (x, y) tuple for center of match if found. False otherwise. pass a rect tuple (x, y, width, height) as the region argument to narrow down the area to look for the image. Adjust threshold for the precision of the match (between 0 and 1, the lowest being more precise). Set debug to True for extra debug info

pixel_matches_color(xy, expected_rgb, tolerance=0)¶
screenshot(name, region=None)¶
wizsdk.pixels.match_image(largeImg, smallImg, threshold=0.1, debug=False)¶

Finds smallImg in largeImg using template matching Adjust threshold for the precision of the match (between 0 and 1, the lowest being more precise) Returns false if no match was found with the given threshold
